DD2358 Scatt3D documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

Scatt3D.memTimeEstimation(folder, numCells=0, Nf=0, printPlots=False)¶

Estimes the execution time and memory requirements of the Scatt3d run, based on previous runs.

Previous run information is stored in prevRuns.info in the folder. Assumes that the memory cost scales with the volume of the computation/h^3 (the number of mesh cells). Time taken should then scale with the memory times the number of frequency points.

Parameters:

  • folder – folder to store and retrieve prevRuns.info

  • numCells – estimated number of mesh cells, if asking for an estimated time/memory cost

  • Nf – number of freq. points, when asking for an estimated time

  • printPlots – if True, plots the memory and time requirements of previous runs, along with the fit used for estimation

Scatt3D.runScatt3d(runName, reference=False, folder='data3D', verbose=True, viewGMSH=False)¶

Runs a scattering simulation

Parameters:

  • runName – this will be prepended to the various saved filenames

  • reference – runs without any defects contained in the mesh - possibly saves only what’s needed for calculations, too

  • folder – folder to save data and stuff in

  • verbose – prints some extra stuff about how many freqs have been calculated (things you dont want to see when iterating)

  • viewGMSH – to just make the mesh, view it with fltk, then close
